newsitem.title: USA: US Midwest hog prices seen steady-off $0.50- trade.
newsitem.headline: US Midwest hog prices seen steady-off $0.50- trade.

text.p: U.S. Midwest direct cash hog prices Tuesday were seen mostly steady to instances $0.50 per cwt lower amid sluggish pork prices and active marketings, livestock dealers said.
Top prices for hogs delivered to plants in Iowa and southern Minndesota could range $56.50 to $57.50, with at least one major packer saying they were halfway done buying hogs for Wednesday.
Illinois hog prices could remain unchanged and range $56.00 to $57.00 for top hog prices at plants. Indiana/Ohio top prices at the plant could range $55.50 to $56.00.

Midday pork prices were steady-weak at midday in light trading, with hams steady, bellies $1.00 per cwt lower and trimmings not tested, according to USDA. There were 21.0 pork loads and 2.0 loads of trimmings sold.
Cash price declines could be tempered if marketings start to tighten or loin prices rebound.
Loins can find some strength this time of year for Christmas and Nw Years featuring, market sources said.
